candidates.title: Design CNV telemetry, output, and grammar layers
candidates.body:
This release transforms clap-noun-verb from syntactic sugar over clap into a structured interface layer providing deterministic, agent-grade CLI capabilities.

## New Kernel Modules

### 1. Telemetry Profile (src/kernel/telemetry.rs)
- **VerbosityLevel**: Finite set of verbosity levels (Silent, Normal, Verbose, Debug, Trace)
- **ColorPolicy**: Auto-detect, Always, Never with TTY detection and env var support
- **TelemetryProfile**: Immutable snapshot of command telemetry state
- Deterministic precedence rules: quiet wins over verbose
- Integration with NO_COLOR, CLICOLOR, CLICOLOR_FORCE environment variables
- Builder pattern for flexible profile construction

### 2. Output Pipeline (src/kernel/output.rs)
- **StructuredResult<T>**: Standardized result type for all verbs
- **StructuredError**: Machine-readable errors with context and exit codes
- **OutputEnvelope<T>**: Optional envelope wrapping with success/error status
- **ExitCodeClass**: Consistent exit codes (Success=0, GeneralError=1, UsageError=2, etc.)
- Deterministic formatting with stable field ordering
- Support for metadata injection (execution time, version, etc.)

### 3. Grammar Model (src/kernel/grammar.rs)
- **GrammarModel**: Complete introspectable representation of command tree
- **GrammarNoun**: Noun metadata with verbs and sub-nouns
- **GrammarVerb**: Verb metadata with arguments and deprecation info
- **GrammarArgument**: Rich argument metadata (type, flags, constraints)
- **ArgumentType**: Positional, Named, Flag, Count classification
- Versioned schema (v1.0.0) for stable external tool integration
- Query API for filtering and searching commands

### 4. Manpage Integration (src/kernel/manpage.rs)
- **ManpageGenerator**: Thin wrapper around manpage generation
- Derives from grammar model for consistency
- Generates manpages for main command, nouns, and verbs
- Standard Unix sections (1=User Commands, 5=File Formats, etc.)
- SEE ALSO cross-references
- Author and version information

### 5. File IO Integration (src/kernel/io.rs)
- **InputSource**: Stdin or file with automatic "-" detection
- **OutputSink**: Stdout or file with automatic "-" detection
- **FileIO**: Stream-based IO abstraction for verb handlers
- Multiple input support for merge/concat operations
- Buffered reader/writer support
- Helper methods: read_to_string, read_to_bytes, read_lines, copy
- Structured error integration with exit codes

### 6. Test Harness (src/kernel/test_harness.rs)
- **TestHarness**: API-level introspection for robust testing
- Command enumeration (all nouns, verbs, arguments)
- Grammar snapshot generation for regression testing (JSON/YAML)
- Test case generation (help, version, invalid args)
- Validation report (errors, warnings, info)
- Deprecated command detection
- Compatibility with existing test tools (assert_cmd, trycmd)

## Additional Changes

### Updated Dependencies
- Added Deserialize derive to OutputFormat for serialization
- Version bump: 3.7.1 → 3.8.0
- Updated clap-noun-verb-macros to 3.8.0

### Examples
- Added kernel_example.rs demonstrating all kernel features
- Shows telemetry profile usage
- Demonstrates file IO with --input/-i and --output/-o
- Grammar dump with --dump-grammar flag
- Manpage generation with --generate-manpages flag

### Tests
- Comprehensive kernel_tests.rs integration test suite
- 32 tests covering all kernel modules
- Unit tests in each module
- Integration tests for full pipeline

## Design Principles

1. **Determinism over Configurability**: Fixed policies with predictable semantics
2. **Zero Boilerplate**: Kernel features work automatically with existing CNV apps
3. **Agent-Grade**: All CLIs are discoverable, controllable, and predictable
4. **No Leaky Abstractions**: External libraries (clap_mangen) used as silent backends
5. **Backwards Compatible**: Existing apps continue working without changes

## Migration Path

All kernel features are opt-in. Existing CNV applications can:
- Continue working without changes
- Incrementally adopt telemetry profile
- Incrementally adopt output pipeline
- Add grammar introspection as needed

## Success Metrics

- ✅ All kernel modules implemented
- ✅ 60+ tests passing (28 kernel unit + 32 integration)
- ✅ Zero breaking changes to existing API
- ✅ Comprehensive documentation and examples
- ✅ Ready for agent/autonomic use cases

This release lays the foundation for clap-noun-verb to be the standard for building deterministic, introspectable, machine-controllable CLIs in Rust.

## Description

Brief description of what this PR does.

- [ ] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
- [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected)
- [ ] Documentation update

- [ ] Code refactoring

candidates.title: Design autonomic CLI layer for clap-noun-verb
candidates.body:
Implement Milestones 1 and 2 of the Autonomic CLI Layer PRD, transforming clap-noun-verb into a first-class machine-grade interface for agents, MAPE-K loops, and autonomic systems.

## Features Added

### Core Autonomic Module (src/autonomic/)
- **introspection.rs**: Command introspection with JSON-serializable metadata
  - CommandCapabilities for feature discovery
  - IntrospectionResponse for complete CLI introspection
  - CommandGraph for dependency visualization
  - ArgumentMetadata for detailed argument descriptions

- **effects.rs**: Effect and risk metadata
  - EffectType enum (ReadOnly, MutateState, MutateConfig, etc.)
  - Sensitivity levels (Low, Medium, High, Critical)
  - EffectMetadata with idempotence and role requirements

- **planes.rs**: O/Σ/Q/ΔΣ plane interaction metadata
  - Plane enum for Observations, Ontology, Invariants, Overlays
  - PlaneInteraction builder for declarative plane usage
  - Support for parsing from strings like "O_read,Σ_read"

- **guards.rs**: Guard and budget declarations
  - GuardConfig for latency, memory, and CPU budgets
  - GuardResult for tracking enforcement status
  - GuardStatus enum for evaluation results

- **receipts.rs**: Execution receipt generation
  - ExecutionReceipt with full execution metadata
  - ReceiptWithOutput for including command results
  - SHA-256 hashing support for result verification

- **errors.rs**: Structured error model
  - ErrorKind enum for machine-readable error types
  - StructuredError with typed details
  - ErrorResponse wrapper for JSON output

- **cli.rs**: CLI integration
  - AutonomicCli wrapper for CommandRegistry
  - AutonomicVerbCommand and AutonomicNounCommand traits
  - Methods for capabilities(), introspect(), introspect_json()

### Dependencies
- Add sha2, hex, uuid, chrono for receipt generation and hashing

### Examples & Tests
- autonomic_example.rs: Comprehensive example demonstrating all features
  - Introspection via --introspect flag
  - Capabilities via --capabilities flag
  - Command graph via --graph flag
  - Effect metadata, plane interactions, guards

- autonomic_tests.rs: 11 comprehensive tests covering:
  - Capabilities and introspection
  - Effect metadata
  - Plane interactions
  - Guard configuration and results
  - Structured errors
  - Execution receipts
  - Command graphs
  - JSON serialization

### Documentation
- AUTONOMIC.md: Complete guide to the Autonomic CLI Layer
  - Overview of all features
  - Code examples for each component
  - Integration patterns for MAPE-K loops
  - Future milestone roadmap

- Updated README.md to highlight new autonomic features

## Architecture

The autonomic layer is designed to be:
- **Machine-First**: JSON-first API with human-friendly overlays
- **Zero-Cost When Unused**: Opt-in features with minimal overhead
- **Deterministic**: Same inputs produce same outputs within guards
- **Extensible**: Clear extension points for future milestones

## Testing

All 11 autonomic tests pass:
- test_capabilities
- test_introspection
- test_effect_metadata
- test_plane_interactions
- test_guard_config
- test_guard_result
- test_structured_error
- test_execution_receipt
- test_command_graph
- test_introspection_json_serialization
- test_plane_interaction_from_str

All existing tests continue to pass.

## Future Work

Milestone 3 (Receipts & Autonomic Mode) and beyond are documented in AUTONOMIC.md and ready for implementation.

## Description

Brief description of what this PR does.

- [ ] Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [ ] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
- [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected)
- [ ] Documentation update
- [ ] Performance improvement
- [ ] Code refactoring

## Changes Made
